id: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to simplify the currency derivative class hierarchy (DER-126).
name: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to simplify the currency derivative class hierarchy (DER-126).

id: currency option whose underlying asset is based on the volatility of a foreign exchange rate
name: currency option whose underlying asset is based on the volatility of a foreign exchange rate

id: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate a reference to a deprecated property.
name: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate a reference to a deprecated property.

id: The holders of a currency forward are obligated to buy or sell the currency at a specified price, at a specified quantity and on a specified future date. These contracts cannot be transferred. Jan 10 Review Notes Outright Forward is the term for the professional markets. Spot + Swap where Swap is 2 simultaneous transactions.
name: The holders of a currency forward are obligated to buy or sell the currency at a specified price, at a specified quantity and on a specified future date. These contracts cannot be transferred. Jan 10 Review Notes Outright Forward is the term for the professional markets. Spot + Swap where Swap is 2 simultaneous transactions.

id: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: foreign exchange agreement between two parties involving an exchange of two currencies at agreed fixed rates: a) on the spot settlement date and b) a reverse exchange on a later specified date
name: foreign exchange agreement between two parties involving an exchange of two currencies at agreed fixed rates: a) on the spot settlement date and b) a reverse exchange on a later specified date

id: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary, to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate, and to move the definition of an underlier and the related property, has underlier, to financial instruments so that these concepts are also available for use in relation to pool-backed securities.
name: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary, to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC) and to eliminate redundancies in FIBO as appropriate, and to move the definition of an underlier and the related property, has underlier, to financial instruments so that these concepts are also available for use in relation to pool-backed securities.

id: ISO 10962, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fifth edition, 2021-06-15
name: ISO 10962, Securities and related financial instruments - Classification of financial instruments (CFI) code, Fifth edition, 2021-06-15

id: forward contract in a foreign exchange market that locks in the price at which an entity must buy or sell a currency on a future date
name: forward contract in a foreign exchange market that locks in the price at which an entity must buy or sell a currency on a future date

id: Spot rates represent the price that a buyer expects to pay for a foreign currency in another currency at the time of the quote. Though the spot exchange rate is said to be settled immediately, the globally accepted settlement cycle for foreign-exchange contracts is two days. Foreign-exchange contracts are therefore settled on the second day after the day the deal is made.
name: Spot rates represent the price that a buyer expects to pay for a foreign currency in another currency at the time of the quote. Though the spot exchange rate is said to be settled immediately, the globally accepted settlement cycle for foreign-exchange contracts is two days. Foreign-exchange contracts are therefore settled on the second day after the day the deal is made.

id: foreign exchange agreement between two parties to exchange a given amount of one currency for another currency for spot delivery or for forward delivery at an agreed rate after a specified period of time
name: foreign exchange agreement between two parties to exchange a given amount of one currency for another currency for spot delivery or for forward delivery at an agreed rate after a specified period of time

id: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move properties related to buying and selling currency to a higher level in the ontology, to be available on all currency instruments (DER-143).
name: CurrencyContracts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to move properties related to buying and selling currency to a higher level in the ontology, to be available on all currency instruments (DER-143).

id: EUR so that he or she could stand to gain from an increase in the exchange rate (or the USD rise).
name: EUR so that he or she could stand to gain from an increase in the exchange rate (or the USD rise).

id: rate of exchange between two currencies as specified as of some date and time as quoted by a specific source, typically for a spot contract
name: rate of exchange between two currencies as specified as of some date and time as quoted by a specific source, typically for a spot contract

id: option giving the buyer (holder) the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell currency at a specified exchange rate during a specified period of time
name: option giving the buyer (holder) the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell currency at a specified exchange rate during a specified period of time

id: rate of exchange between two currencies as specified in a forward contract
name: rate of exchange between two currencies as specified in a forward contract

id: agreement to deliver and settle a given amount of money in one currency, in exchange for a given amount in another currency at an agreed rate of exchange
name: agreement to deliver and settle a given amount of money in one currency, in exchange for a given amount in another currency at an agreed rate of exchange

id: In the case of a 'forward-forward' swap, both legs will be of type CurrencyFoward.
name: In the case of a 'forward-forward' swap, both legs will be of type CurrencyFoward.

id: agreement to deliver and settle a given amount of money in one currency, in exchange for a given amount in another currency, at an agreed date in the future and at an agreed rate of exchange
name: agreement to deliver and settle a given amount of money in one currency, in exchange for a given amount in another currency, at an agreed date in the future and at an agreed rate of exchange

id: version of this ontology was modified to reflect the addition of the concept of a rates swap and the corresponding rate-based leg to the Swaps ontology, as well as the concept of a spot forward currency swap, to facilitate mapping to the CFI standard.
name: version of this ontology was modified to reflect the addition of the concept of a rates swap and the corresponding rate-based leg to the Swaps ontology, as well as the concept of a spot forward currency swap, to facilitate mapping to the CFI standard.

id: This ontology defines concepts common to currency spot contracts and foreign exchange derivatives (forwards, options and swaps).
name: This ontology defines concepts common to currency spot contracts and foreign exchange derivatives (forwards, options and swaps).
